For the record, the `SetAngularVelocity` function behaves differently from Gazebo classic when a model contains multiple unconnected kinematic trees. In Gazebo classic, doing `Model::SetAngularVel` on the `box` model from the example above (move_entity.sdf) causes the two boxes to just rotate about their own axis without any linear velocity whereas calling `FreeGroup::SetAngularVelocity` on the model FreeGroup applies both linear and angular velocities to the non-canonical link. 

**Gazebo classic:**

![classic_setangvel.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/5q9rMzd/images/2990982215-classic_setangvel.gif)

vs** Ign-gazebo**
